monq.jfa.actions

Class Copy

  • java.lang.Object
    • monq.jfa.AbstractFaAction
      • monq.jfa.actions.Copy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FaAction

    public class Copy
extends AbstractFaAction
    implements an FaAction which merely copies matched input to the output. If only a Copy object with priority zero is needed, then predefined object COPY should be used instead of creating a new Copy object.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.6 $, $Date: 2005-02-22 18:51:19 $
    Author:
    © 2003, 2004 Harald Kirsch
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static FaAction COPY
      a predefined FaAction with priority 0 which merely copies matched text unchanged to the output.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Copy(int priority)
      use only if COPY is not what you want, because you have to specify a priority.

    • Field Detail

      • COPY

        public static final FaAction COPY
        a predefined FaAction with priority 0 which merely copies matched text unchanged to the output. Only if priority 0 is not what you want, create a new Copy object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Copy

        public Copy(int priority)
        use only if COPY is not what you want, because you have to specify a priority.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public void invoke(java.lang.StringBuilder out,
          int start,
          DfaRun runner)
        Description copied from interface: FaAction

        is called by methods of DfaRun in case of a match. Parameter yytext contains the matching text from position start onwards. The callback may change the whole of yytext, but the under most circumstances, only the matching text should be changed. Parameter runner is the DfaRun object which called this function. Of interest are its fields DfaRun.clientData and DfaRun.collect.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
